option.name: content
option.value: 对以下代码进行优化：

option.name: content
option.value: 对以下代码进行优化：

option.name: content
option.value: 对以下代码进行优化：

option.name: selectText
option.value:
version: '3.8'
services: # Redis Service redis: image: redis:7.0 container_name: redis_202505 ports: - "6379:6379" volumes: - ./docker/redis/redis-data:/data command: redis-server --appendonly yes
# MySQL Service mysql: image: mysql:8.0.29 container_name: mysql_202505 ports: - "3306:3306" environment: MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD: bk123$%^ MYSQL_DATABASE: gordon_db MYSQL_USER: gordon MYSQL_PASSWORD: bk123$%^ volumes: - ./docker/mysql/mysql-data:/var/lib/mysql - ./docker/mysql/mysql-init:/docker-entrypoint-initdb.d
# PHPMyAdmin Service phpmyadmin: image: phpmyadmin container_name: phpmyadmin_202505 ports: - "8080:80" environment: PMA_HOST: mysql_202505 PMA_USER: root PMA_PASSWORD: bk123$%^ depends_on: - mysql
setup: profiles: - setup build: context: setup/ args: ELASTIC_VERSION: ${ELASTIC_VERSION} init: true volumes: - ./setup/entrypoint.sh:/entrypoint.sh:ro,Z - ./setup/lib.sh:/lib.sh:ro,Z - ./setup/roles:/roles:ro,Z environment: ELASTIC_PASSWORD: ${ELASTIC_PASSWORD:-} LOGSTASH_INTERNAL_PASSWORD: ${LOGSTASH_INTERNAL_PASSWORD:-} KIBANA_SYSTEM_PASSWORD: ${KIBANA_SYSTEM_PASSWORD:-} METRICBEAT_INTERNAL_PASSWORD: ${METRICBEAT_INTERNAL_PASSWORD:-} FILEBEAT_INTERNAL_PASSWORD: ${FILEBEAT_INTERNAL_PASSWORD:-} HEARTBEAT_INTERNAL_PASSWORD: ${HEARTBEAT_INTERNAL_PASSWORD:-} MONITORING_INTERNAL_PASSWORD: ${MONITORING_INTERNAL_PASSWORD:-} BEATS_SYSTEM_PASSWORD: ${BEATS_SYSTEM_PASSWORD:-} networks: - elk depends_on: - elasticsearch
# Elasticsearch Service elasticsearch: build: context: elasticsearch/ args: ELASTIC_VERSION: ${ELASTIC_VERSION} container_name: elasticsearch_202505 volumes: - ./docker/elasticsearch/config/elasticsearch.yml:/usr/share/elasticsearch/config/elasticsearch.yml:ro,Z - ./docker/elasticsearch:/usr/share/elasticsearch/data:Z ports: - 9200:9200 - 9300:9300 environment: node.name: elasticsearch ES_JAVA_OPTS: -Xms512m -Xmx512m # Bootstrap password. # Used to initialize the keystore during the initial startup of # Elasticsearch. Ignored on subsequent runs. ELASTIC_PASSWORD: ${ELASTIC_PASSWORD:-} # Use single node discovery in order to disable production mode and avoid bootstrap checks. # see: https://www.elastic.co/docs/deploy-manage/deploy/self-managed/bootstrap-checks discovery.type: single-node networks: - elk
# Logstash Service logstash: build: context: logstash/ args: ELASTIC_VERSION: ${ELASTIC_VERSION} container_name: logstash_202505 volumes: - ./docker/logstash/config/logstash.yml:/usr/share/logstash/config/logstash.yml:ro,Z - ./docker/logstash/pipeline:/usr/share/logstash/pipeline:ro,Z ports: - 5044:5044 - 50000:50000/tcp - 50000:50000/udp - 9600:9600 environment: LS_JAVA_OPTS: -Xms256m -Xmx256m LOGSTASH_INTERNAL_PASSWORD: ${LOGSTASH_INTERNAL_PASSWORD:-} networks: - elk depends_on: - elasticsearch
# Kibana Service kibana: build: context: kibana/ args: ELASTIC_VERSION: ${ELASTIC_VERSION} container_name: kibana_202505 volumes: - ./kibana/config/kibana.yml:/usr/share/kibana/config/kibana.yml:ro,Z ports: - 5601:5601 environment: KIBANA_SYSTEM_PASSWORD: ${KIBANA_SYSTEM_PASSWORD:-} networks: - elk depends_on: - elasticsearch
networks: elk: driver: bridge
volumes: elasticsearch:

option.name: content
option.value:
I'll analyze the docker-compose.yaml file and suggest several optimizations:
1. **Security Improvements**: - Remove hardcoded passwords (like `bk123$%^`) and use environment variables or Docker secrets - Add restart policies for critical services - Consider adding health checks for services
2. **Resource Management**: - Add resource limits (CPU/memory) to prevent any single service from consuming too many resources - Adjust Java heap sizes based on your available system resources
3. **Structure Improvements**: - Group related services together (ELK stack together, database services together) - Use consistent naming conventions (either all with _202505 suffix or none) - Consider using YAML anchors for repeated configurations
4. **Performance Optimizations**: - Add proper volume drivers if needed - Consider adding read-only mounts where appropriate - Optimize port mappings (remove unnecessary exposed ports)
Here's an optimized version with these improvements:
```yaml version: '3.8'
services: # Database Services redis: image: redis:7.0 container_name: redis ports: - "6379:6379" volumes: - redis_data:/data command: redis-server --appendonly yes restart: unless-stopped healthcheck: test: ["CMD", "redis-cli", "ping"] interval: 5s timeout: 3s retries: 3
mysql: image: mysql:8.0.29 container_name: mysql ports: - "3306:3306" environment: MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD: ${MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD} MYSQL_DATABASE: ${MYSQL_DATABASE} MYSQL_USER: ${MYSQL_USER} MYSQL_PASSWORD: ${MYSQL_PASSWORD} volumes: - mysql_data:/var/lib/mysql - ./docker/mysql/mysql-init:/docker-entrypoint-initdb.d:ro restart: unless-stopped healthcheck: test: ["CMD", "mysqladmin", "ping", "-h", "localhost"] timeout: 20s retries: 10
phpmyadmin: image: phpmyadmin container_name: phpmyadmin ports: - "8080:80" environment: PMA_HOST: mysql PMA_USER: root PMA_PASSWORD: ${MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD} depends_on: mysql: condition: service_healthy restart: unless-stopped
# ELK Stack Services elasticsearch: build: context: elasticsearch/ args: ELASTIC_VERSION: ${ELASTIC_VERSION} container_name: elasticsearch volumes: - elasticsearch_config:/usr/share/elasticsearch/config:ro - elasticsearch_data:/usr/share/elasticsearch/data ports: - 9200:9200 - 9300:9300 environment: node.name: elasticsearch ES_JAVA_OPTS: -Xms1g -Xmx1g ELASTIC_PASSWORD: ${ELASTIC_PASSWORD} discovery.type: single-node networks: - elk restart: unless-stopped healthcheck: test: ["CMD-SHELL", "curl -s -k http://localhost:9200"] interval: 10s timeout: 10s retries: 5
logstash: build: context: logstash/ args: ELASTIC_VERSION: ${ELASTIC_VERSION} container_name: logstash volumes: - ./docker/logstash/config:/usr/share/logstash/config:ro - ./docker/logstash/pipeline:/usr/share/logstash/pipeline:ro ports: - 5044:5044 - 50000:50000/tcp - 50000:50000/udp environment: LS_JAVA_OPTS: -Xms512m -Xmx512m LOGSTASH_INTERNAL_PASSWORD: ${LOGSTASH_INTERNAL_PASSWORD} networks: - elk depends_on: elasticsearch: condition: service_healthy restart: unless-stopped deploy: resources: limits: cpus: '1' memory: 1G
kibana: build: context: kibana/ args: ELASTIC_VERSION: ${ELASTIC_VERSION} container_name: kibana volumes: - ./kibana/config:/usr/share/kibana/config:ro ports: - 5601:5601 environment: KIBANA_SYSTEM_PASSWORD: ${KIBANA_SYSTEM_PASSWORD} networks: - elk depends_on: elasticsearch: condition: service_healthy restart: unless-stopped
setup: profiles: - setup build: context: setup/ args: ELASTIC_VERSION: ${ELASTIC_VERSION} init: true volumes: - ./setup/entrypoint.sh:/entrypoint.sh:ro - ./setup/lib.sh:/lib.sh:ro - ./setup/roles:/roles:ro environment: ELASTIC_PASSWORD: ${ELASTIC_PASSWORD} LOGSTASH_INTERNAL_PASSWORD: ${LOGSTASH_INTERNAL_PASSWORD} KIBANA_SYSTEM_PASSWORD: ${KIBANA_SYSTEM_PASSWORD} networks: - elk depends_on: elasticsearch: condition: service_healthy
networks: elk: driver: bridge
volumes: redis_data: mysql_data: elasticsearch_config: elasticsearch_data: ```
Key changes made: 1. Replaced hardcoded passwords with environment variables 2. Added health checks for critical services 3. Added restart policies 4. Improved volume management with named volumes 5. Added resource limits for Java services 6. Removed unnecessary container name suffixes 7. Improved service dependencies with health conditions 8. Grouped related services together 9. Added read-only mounts where appropriate 10. Simplified port mappings where possible
Remember to: 1. Create a `.env` file for all the environment variables 2. Adjust memory settings based on your host machine's resources 3. Consider adding logging configurations for production use 4. Review security settings before deploying to production

option.name: content
option.value:
I'll analyze the docker-compose.yaml file and suggest several optimizations:
1. **Security Improvements**: - Remove hardcoded passwords (like `bk123$%^`) and use environment variables or Docker secrets - Add restart policies for critical services - Consider adding health checks for services
2. **Resource Management**: - Add resource limits (CPU/memory) to prevent any single service from consuming too many resources - Adjust Java heap sizes based on your available system resources
3. **Structure Improvements**: - Group related services together (ELK stack together, database services together) - Use consistent naming conventions (either all with _202505 suffix or none) - Consider using YAML anchors for repeated configurations
4. **Performance Optimizations**: - Add proper volume drivers if needed - Consider adding read-only mounts where appropriate - Optimize port mappings (remove unnecessary exposed ports)
Here's an optimized version with these improvements:
```yaml version: '3.8'
services: # Database Services redis: image: redis:7.0 container_name: redis ports: - "6379:6379" volumes: - redis_data:/data command: redis-server --appendonly yes restart: unless-stopped healthcheck: test: ["CMD", "redis-cli", "ping"] interval: 5s timeout: 3s retries: 3
mysql: image: mysql:8.0.29 container_name: mysql ports: - "3306:3306" environment: MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD: ${MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD} MYSQL_DATABASE: ${MYSQL_DATABASE} MYSQL_USER: ${MYSQL_USER} MYSQL_PASSWORD: ${MYSQL_PASSWORD} volumes: - mysql_data:/var/lib/mysql - ./docker/mysql/mysql-init:/docker-entrypoint-initdb.d:ro restart: unless-stopped healthcheck: test: ["CMD", "mysqladmin", "ping", "-h", "localhost"] timeout: 20s retries: 10
phpmyadmin: image: phpmyadmin container_name: phpmyadmin ports: - "8080:80" environment: PMA_HOST: mysql PMA_USER: root PMA_PASSWORD: ${MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD} depends_on: mysql: condition: service_healthy restart: unless-stopped
# ELK Stack Services elasticsearch: build: context: elasticsearch/ args: ELASTIC_VERSION: ${ELASTIC_VERSION} container_name: elasticsearch volumes: - elasticsearch_config:/usr/share/elasticsearch/config:ro - elasticsearch_data:/usr/share/elasticsearch/data ports: - 9200:9200 - 9300:9300 environment: node.name: elasticsearch ES_JAVA_OPTS: -Xms1g -Xmx1g ELASTIC_PASSWORD: ${ELASTIC_PASSWORD} discovery.type: single-node networks: - elk restart: unless-stopped healthcheck: test: ["CMD-SHELL", "curl -s -k http://localhost:9200"] interval: 10s timeout: 10s retries: 5
logstash: build: context: logstash/ args: ELASTIC_VERSION: ${ELASTIC_VERSION} container_name: logstash volumes: - ./docker/logstash/config:/usr/share/logstash/config:ro - ./docker/logstash/pipeline:/usr/share/logstash/pipeline:ro ports: - 5044:5044 - 50000:50000/tcp - 50000:50000/udp environment: LS_JAVA_OPTS: -Xms512m -Xmx512m LOGSTASH_INTERNAL_PASSWORD: ${LOGSTASH_INTERNAL_PASSWORD} networks: - elk depends_on: elasticsearch: condition: service_healthy restart: unless-stopped deploy: resources: limits: cpus: '1' memory: 1G
kibana: build: context: kibana/ args: ELASTIC_VERSION: ${ELASTIC_VERSION} container_name: kibana volumes: - ./kibana/config:/usr/share/kibana/config:ro ports: - 5601:5601 environment: KIBANA_SYSTEM_PASSWORD: ${KIBANA_SYSTEM_PASSWORD} networks: - elk depends_on: elasticsearch: condition: service_healthy restart: unless-stopped
setup: profiles: - setup build: context: setup/ args: ELASTIC_VERSION: ${ELASTIC_VERSION} init: true volumes: - ./setup/entrypoint.sh:/entrypoint.sh:ro - ./setup/lib.sh:/lib.sh:ro - ./setup/roles:/roles:ro environment: ELASTIC_PASSWORD: ${ELASTIC_PASSWORD} LOGSTASH_INTERNAL_PASSWORD: ${LOGSTASH_INTERNAL_PASSWORD} KIBANA_SYSTEM_PASSWORD: ${KIBANA_SYSTEM_PASSWORD} networks: - elk depends_on: elasticsearch: condition: service_healthy
networks: elk: driver: bridge
volumes: redis_data: mysql_data: elasticsearch_config: elasticsearch_data: ```
Key changes made: 1. Replaced hardcoded passwords with environment variables 2. Added health checks for critical services 3. Added restart policies 4. Improved volume management with named volumes 5. Added resource limits for Java services 6. Removed unnecessary container name suffixes 7. Improved service dependencies with health conditions 8. Grouped related services together 9. Added read-only mounts where appropriate 10. Simplified port mappings where possible
Remember to: 1. Create a `.env` file for all the environment variables 2. Adjust memory settings based on your host machine's resources 3. Consider adding logging configurations for production use 4. Review security settings before deploying to production

option.name: content
option.value:
I'll analyze the docker-compose.yaml file and suggest several optimizations:
1. **Security Improvements**: - Remove hardcoded passwords (like `bk123$%^`) and use environment variables or Docker secrets - Add restart policies for critical services - Consider adding health checks for services
2. **Resource Management**: - Add resource limits (CPU/memory) to prevent any single service from consuming too many resources - Adjust Java heap sizes based on your available system resources
3. **Structure Improvements**: - Group related services together (ELK stack together, database services together) - Use consistent naming conventions (either all with _202505 suffix or none) - Consider using YAML anchors for repeated configurations
4. **Performance Optimizations**: - Add proper volume drivers if needed - Consider adding read-only mounts where appropriate - Optimize port mappings (remove unnecessary exposed ports)
Here's an optimized version with these improvements:
```yaml version: '3.8'
services: # Database Services redis: image: redis:7.0 container_name: redis ports: - "6379:6379" volumes: - redis_data:/data command: redis-server --appendonly yes restart: unless-stopped healthcheck: test: ["CMD", "redis-cli", "ping"] interval: 5s timeout: 3s retries: 3
mysql: image: mysql:8.0.29 container_name: mysql ports: - "3306:3306" environment: MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD: ${MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD} MYSQL_DATABASE: ${MYSQL_DATABASE} MYSQL_USER: ${MYSQL_USER} MYSQL_PASSWORD: ${MYSQL_PASSWORD} volumes: - mysql_data:/var/lib/mysql - ./docker/mysql/mysql-init:/docker-entrypoint-initdb.d:ro restart: unless-stopped healthcheck: test: ["CMD", "mysqladmin", "ping", "-h", "localhost"] timeout: 20s retries: 10
phpmyadmin: image: phpmyadmin container_name: phpmyadmin ports: - "8080:80" environment: PMA_HOST: mysql PMA_USER: root PMA_PASSWORD: ${MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD} depends_on: mysql: condition: service_healthy restart: unless-stopped
# ELK Stack Services elasticsearch: build: context: elasticsearch/ args: ELASTIC_VERSION: ${ELASTIC_VERSION} container_name: elasticsearch volumes: - elasticsearch_config:/usr/share/elasticsearch/config:ro - elasticsearch_data:/usr/share/elasticsearch/data ports: - 9200:9200 - 9300:9300 environment: node.name: elasticsearch ES_JAVA_OPTS: -Xms1g -Xmx1g ELASTIC_PASSWORD: ${ELASTIC_PASSWORD} discovery.type: single-node networks: - elk restart: unless-stopped healthcheck: test: ["CMD-SHELL", "curl -s -k http://localhost:9200"] interval: 10s timeout: 10s retries: 5
logstash: build: context: logstash/ args: ELASTIC_VERSION: ${ELASTIC_VERSION} container_name: logstash volumes: - ./docker/logstash/config:/usr/share/logstash/config:ro - ./docker/logstash/pipeline:/usr/share/logstash/pipeline:ro ports: - 5044:5044 - 50000:50000/tcp - 50000:50000/udp environment: LS_JAVA_OPTS: -Xms512m -Xmx512m LOGSTASH_INTERNAL_PASSWORD: ${LOGSTASH_INTERNAL_PASSWORD} networks: - elk depends_on: elasticsearch: condition: service_healthy restart: unless-stopped deploy: resources: limits: cpus: '1' memory: 1G
kibana: build: context: kibana/ args: ELASTIC_VERSION: ${ELASTIC_VERSION} container_name: kibana volumes: - ./kibana/config:/usr/share/kibana/config:ro ports: - 5601:5601 environment: KIBANA_SYSTEM_PASSWORD: ${KIBANA_SYSTEM_PASSWORD} networks: - elk depends_on: elasticsearch: condition: service_healthy restart: unless-stopped
setup: profiles: - setup build: context: setup/ args: ELASTIC_VERSION: ${ELASTIC_VERSION} init: true volumes: - ./setup/entrypoint.sh:/entrypoint.sh:ro - ./setup/lib.sh:/lib.sh:ro - ./setup/roles:/roles:ro environment: ELASTIC_PASSWORD: ${ELASTIC_PASSWORD} LOGSTASH_INTERNAL_PASSWORD: ${LOGSTASH_INTERNAL_PASSWORD} KIBANA_SYSTEM_PASSWORD: ${KIBANA_SYSTEM_PASSWORD} networks: - elk depends_on: elasticsearch: condition: service_healthy
networks: elk: driver: bridge
volumes: redis_data: mysql_data: elasticsearch_config: elasticsearch_data: ```
Key changes made: 1. Replaced hardcoded passwords with environment variables 2. Added health checks for critical services 3. Added restart policies 4. Improved volume management with named volumes 5. Added resource limits for Java services 6. Removed unnecessary container name suffixes 7. Improved service dependencies with health conditions 8. Grouped related services together 9. Added read-only mounts where appropriate 10. Simplified port mappings where possible
Remember to: 1. Create a `.env` file for all the environment variables 2. Adjust memory settings based on your host machine's resources 3. Consider adding logging configurations for production use 4. Review security settings before deploying to production

option.name: title
option.value: 对以下代码进行优化：

option.name: answer
option.value:
R'oo zmzobav gsv wlxpvi-xlnklhv.bzno urov zmw hfttvhg hvevizo lkgrnrazgrlmh:
8. **Hvxfirgb Rnkilevnvmgh**: - Ivnlev sziwxlwvw kzhhdliwh (orpv `yp876$%^`) zmw fhv vmerilmnvmg ezirzyovh li Wlxpvi hvxivgh - Zww ivhgzig klorxrvh uli xirgrxzo hvierxvh - Xlmhrwvi zwwrmt svzogs xsvxph uli hvierxvh
7. **Ivhlfixv Nzmztvnvmg**: - Zww ivhlfixv ornrgh (XKF/nvnlib) gl kivevmg zmb hrmtov hvierxv uiln xlmhfnrmt gll nzmb ivhlfixvh - Zwqfhg Qzez svzk hravh yzhvw lm blfi zezrozyov hbhgvn ivhlfixvh
6. **Hgifxgfiv Rnkilevnvmgh**: - Tilfk ivozgvw hvierxvh gltvgsvi (VOP hgzxp gltvgsvi, wzgzyzhv hvierxvh gltvgsvi) - Fhv xlmhrhgvmg mznrmt xlmevmgrlmh (vrgsvi zoo drgs _797494 hfuurc li mlmv) - Xlmhrwvi fhrmt BZNO zmxslih uli ivkvzgvw xlmurtfizgrlmh
5. **Kviulinzmxv Lkgrnrazgrlmh**: - Zww kilkvi elofnv wirevih ru mvvwvw - Xlmhrwvi zwwrmt ivzw-lmob nlfmgh dsviv zkkilkirzgv - Lkgrnrav klig nzkkrmth (ivnlev fmmvxvhhzib vcklhvw kligh)
Sviv'h zm lkgrnravw evihrlm drgs gsvhv rnkilevnvmgh:
```bzno evihrlm: '6.1'
hvierxvh: # Wzgzyzhv Hvierxvh ivwrh: rnztv: ivwrh:2.9 xlmgzrmvi_mznv: ivwrh kligh: - "3620:3620" elofnvh: - ivwrh_wzgz:/wzgz xlnnzmw: ivwrh-hvievi --zkkvmwlmob bvh ivhgzig: fmovhh-hglkkvw svzogsxsvxp: gvhg: ["XNW", "ivwrh-xor", "krmt"] rmgviezo: 4h grnvlfg: 6h ivgirvh: 6
nbhjo: rnztv: nbhjo:1.9.70 xlmgzrmvi_mznv: nbhjo kligh: - "6693:6693" vmerilmnvmg: NBHJO_ILLG_KZHHDLIW: ${NBHJO_ILLG_KZHHDLIW} NBHJO_WZGZYZHV: ${NBHJO_WZGZYZHV} NBHJO_FHVI: ${NBHJO_FHVI} NBHJO_KZHHDLIW: ${NBHJO_KZHHDLIW} elofnvh: - nbhjo_wzgz:/ezi/ory/nbhjo - ./wlxpvi/nbhjo/nbhjo-rmrg:/wlxpvi-vmgibklrmg-rmrgwy.w:il ivhgzig: fmovhh-hglkkvw svzogsxsvxp: gvhg: ["XNW", "nbhjozwnrm", "krmt", "-s", "olxzoslhg"] grnvlfg: 79h ivgirvh: 89
ksknbzwnrm: rnztv: ksknbzwnrm xlmgzrmvi_mznv: ksknbzwnrm kligh: - "1919:19" vmerilmnvmg: KNZ_SLHG: nbhjo KNZ_FHVI: illg KNZ_KZHHDLIW: ${NBHJO_ILLG_KZHHDLIW} wvkvmwh_lm: nbhjo: xlmwrgrlm: hvierxv_svzogsb ivhgzig: fmovhh-hglkkvw
# VOP Hgzxp Hvierxvh vozhgrxhvzixs: yfrow: xlmgvcg: vozhgrxhvzixs/ zith: VOZHGRX_EVIHRLM: ${VOZHGRX_EVIHRLM} xlmgzrmvi_mznv: vozhgrxhvzixs elofnvh: - vozhgrxhvzixs_xlmurt:/fhi/hsziv/vozhgrxhvzixs/xlmurt:il - vozhgrxhvzixs_wzgz:/fhi/hsziv/vozhgrxhvzixs/wzgz kligh: - 0799:0799 - 0699:0699 vmerilmnvmg: mlwv.mznv: vozhgrxhvzixs VH_QZEZ_LKGH: -Cnh8t -Cnc8t VOZHGRX_KZHHDLIW: ${VOZHGRX_KZHHDLIW} wrhxlevib.gbkv: hrmtov-mlwv mvgdliph: - vop ivhgzig: fmovhh-hglkkvw svzogsxsvxp: gvhg: ["XNW-HSVOO", "xfio -h -p sggk://olxzoslhg:0799"] rmgviezo: 89h grnvlfg: 89h ivgirvh: 4
olthgzhs: yfrow: xlmgvcg: olthgzhs/ zith: VOZHGRX_EVIHRLM: ${VOZHGRX_EVIHRLM} xlmgzrmvi_mznv: olthgzhs elofnvh: - ./wlxpvi/olthgzhs/xlmurt:/fhi/hsziv/olthgzhs/xlmurt:il - ./wlxpvi/olthgzhs/krkvormv:/fhi/hsziv/olthgzhs/krkvormv:il kligh: - 4955:4955 - 49999:49999/gxk - 49999:49999/fwk vmerilmnvmg: OH_QZEZ_LKGH: -Cnh487n -Cnc487n OLTHGZHS_RMGVIMZO_KZHHDLIW: ${OLTHGZHS_RMGVIMZO_KZHHDLIW} mvgdliph: - vop wvkvmwh_lm: vozhgrxhvzixs: xlmwrgrlm: hvierxv_svzogsb ivhgzig: fmovhh-hglkkvw wvkolb: ivhlfixvh: ornrgh: xkfh: '8' nvnlib: 8T
pryzmz: yfrow: xlmgvcg: pryzmz/ zith: VOZHGRX_EVIHRLM: ${VOZHGRX_EVIHRLM} xlmgzrmvi_mznv: pryzmz elofnvh: - ./pryzmz/xlmurt:/fhi/hsziv/pryzmz/xlmurt:il kligh: - 4398:4398 vmerilmnvmg: PRYZMZ_HBHGVN_KZHHDLIW: ${PRYZMZ_HBHGVN_KZHHDLIW} mvgdliph: - vop wvkvmwh_lm: vozhgrxhvzixs: xlmwrgrlm: hvierxv_svzogsb ivhgzig: fmovhh-hglkkvw
hvgfk: kilurovh: - hvgfk yfrow: xlmgvcg: hvgfk/ zith: VOZHGRX_EVIHRLM: ${VOZHGRX_EVIHRLM} rmrg: gifv elofnvh: - ./hvgfk/vmgibklrmg.hs:/vmgibklrmg.hs:il - ./hvgfk/ory.hs:/ory.hs:il - ./hvgfk/ilovh:/ilovh:il vmerilmnvmg: VOZHGRX_KZHHDLIW: ${VOZHGRX_KZHHDLIW} OLTHGZHS_RMGVIMZO_KZHHDLIW: ${OLTHGZHS_RMGVIMZO_KZHHDLIW} PRYZMZ_HBHGVN_KZHHDLIW: ${PRYZMZ_HBHGVN_KZHHDLIW} mvgdliph: - vop wvkvmwh_lm: vozhgrxhvzixs: xlmwrgrlm: hvierxv_svzogsb
mvgdliph: vop: wirevi: yirwtv
elofnvh: ivwrh_wzgz: nbhjo_wzgz: vozhgrxhvzixs_xlmurt: vozhgrxhvzixs_wzgz: ```
Pvb xszmtvh nzwv: 8. Ivkozxvw sziwxlwvw kzhhdliwh drgs vmerilmnvmg ezirzyovh 7. Zwwvw svzogs xsvxph uli xirgrxzo hvierxvh 6. Zwwvw ivhgzig klorxrvh 5. Rnkilevw elofnv nzmztvnvmg drgs mznvw elofnvh 4. Zwwvw ivhlfixv ornrgh uli Qzez hvierxvh 3. Ivnlevw fmmvxvhhzib xlmgzrmvi mznv hfuurcvh 2. Rnkilevw hvierxv wvkvmwvmxrvh drgs svzogs xlmwrgrlmh 1. Tilfkvw ivozgvw hvierxvh gltvgsvi 0. entry.value:
version: '3.8'
services: # Redis Service redis: image: redis:7.0 container_name: redis_202505 ports: - "6379:6379" volumes: - ./docker/redis/redis-data:/data command: redis-server --appendonly yes
# MySQL Service mysql: image: mysql:8.0.29 container_name: mysql_202505 ports: - "3306:3306" environment: MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD: bk123$%^ MYSQL_DATABASE: gordon_db MYSQL_USER: gordon MYSQL_PASSWORD: bk123$%^ volumes: - ./docker/mysql/mysql-data:/var/lib/mysql - ./docker/mysql/mysql-init:/docker-entrypoint-initdb.d
# PHPMyAdmin Service phpmyadmin: image: phpmyadmin container_name: phpmyadmin_202505 ports: - "8080:80" environment: PMA_HOST: mysql_202505 PMA_USER: root PMA_PASSWORD: bk123$%^ depends_on: - mysql
setup: profiles: - setup build: context: setup/ args: ELASTIC_VERSION: ${ELASTIC_VERSION} init: true volumes: - ./setup/entrypoint.sh:/entrypoint.sh:ro,Z - ./setup/lib.sh:/lib.sh:ro,Z - ./setup/roles:/roles:ro,Z environment: ELASTIC_PASSWORD: ${ELASTIC_PASSWORD:-} LOGSTASH_INTERNAL_PASSWORD: ${LOGSTASH_INTERNAL_PASSWORD:-} KIBANA_SYSTEM_PASSWORD: ${KIBANA_SYSTEM_PASSWORD:-} METRICBEAT_INTERNAL_PASSWORD: ${METRICBEAT_INTERNAL_PASSWORD:-} FILEBEAT_INTERNAL_PASSWORD: ${FILEBEAT_INTERNAL_PASSWORD:-} HEARTBEAT_INTERNAL_PASSWORD: ${HEARTBEAT_INTERNAL_PASSWORD:-} MONITORING_INTERNAL_PASSWORD: ${MONITORING_INTERNAL_PASSWORD:-} BEATS_SYSTEM_PASSWORD: ${BEATS_SYSTEM_PASSWORD:-} networks: - elk depends_on: - elasticsearch
# Elasticsearch Service elasticsearch: build: context: elasticsearch/ args: ELASTIC_VERSION: ${ELASTIC_VERSION} container_name: elasticsearch_202505 volumes: - ./docker/elasticsearch/config/elasticsearch.yml:/usr/share/elasticsearch/config/elasticsearch.yml:ro,Z - ./docker/elasticsearch:/usr/share/elasticsearch/data:Z ports: - 9200:9200 - 9300:9300 environment: node.name: elasticsearch ES_JAVA_OPTS: -Xms512m -Xmx512m # Bootstrap password. # Used to initialize the keystore during the initial startup of # Elasticsearch. Ignored on subsequent runs. ELASTIC_PASSWORD: ${ELASTIC_PASSWORD:-} # Use single node discovery in order to disable production mode and avoid bootstrap checks. # see: https://www.elastic.co/docs/deploy-manage/deploy/self-managed/bootstrap-checks discovery.type: single-node networks: - elk
# Logstash Service logstash: build: context: logstash/ args: ELASTIC_VERSION: ${ELASTIC_VERSION} container_name: logstash_202505 volumes: - ./docker/logstash/config/logstash.yml:/usr/share/logstash/config/logstash.yml:ro,Z - ./docker/logstash/pipeline:/usr/share/logstash/pipeline:ro,Z ports: - 5044:5044 - 50000:50000/tcp - 50000:50000/udp - 9600:9600 environment: LS_JAVA_OPTS: -Xms256m -Xmx256m LOGSTASH_INTERNAL_PASSWORD: ${LOGSTASH_INTERNAL_PASSWORD:-} networks: - elk depends_on: - elasticsearch
# Kibana Service kibana: build: context: kibana/ args: ELASTIC_VERSION: ${ELASTIC_VERSION} container_name: kibana_202505 volumes: - ./kibana/config/kibana.yml:/usr/share/kibana/config/kibana.yml:ro,Z ports: - 5601:5601 environment: KIBANA_SYSTEM_PASSWORD: ${KIBANA_SYSTEM_PASSWORD:-} networks: - elk depends_on: - elasticsearch
networks: elk: driver: bridge
volumes: elasticsearch:

option.name: question
option.value: 对以下代码进行优化：
